main event: A bright, white object that was three to four times larger than a star was observed near Stewart Air Force Base, New York on January 12, 1951.
interesting points: The object had a red tail or flight trail and appeared to zig-zag in an abrupt fashion.
The observer stated the object did not appear to be a conventional aircraft and displayed traits of planning and maneuvering ability that discounted the theory of it being a balloon.
The same object was observed the previous day (January 11, 1951) at approximately the same time, but was only visible for several seconds before descending and becoming blocked from view.
The object was observed by a USAF officer with no previous aerial observer experience.
The object was observed for approximately 2 minutes as it faded from sight through high, scattered clouds, with no sound detected.
sighted object: A bright, white object three to four times larger than a star
location: Stewart Air Force Base, New York
